page.title: 18THE RIDING OF THE BOUNDS
page.content: The Berwick Riding of the Bounds is the oldest of all the Border common ridings.On the 1st of May each year anyone with a horse can take part in the ceremony;in recent years the event has risen in popularity.The boundaries were first ridden in 1533 at the command of Henry V111,and has continued unbroken ever since.Many changes have taken place,the route has been changed so that no rivers are forded,after several people were drowned.There used to be a break halfway round at Mordington and flat races took place,but these were stopped due to professionalism.For the last 70 years the ride has been led by J.Moffat,who as leader is presented with a sash by the Mayor of Berwick at the Town Hall steps at the start of the ride,the rest of the riders are given a ribbon and stirrup cup.
